welcome.p1: I am <bold>Helvira Goma</bold>, a Paris based <bold>fullstack developer</bold>.
welcome.p2: When I'm not <bold>transforming ‚ú®</bold> an idea into a functional and interactive project - like this website - I give <bold>conferences</bold> and participate in various <bold>tech events</bold>.
welcome.title: Welcome

profile.about_text:
Helvira Goma is a full-stack developer with over six years of experience who loves making technology feel intuitive, meaningful, and a little bit magical.

 When she‚Äôs not deep in code, she‚Äôs on stage sharing stories about tech, creativity, and the human side of engineering ‚Äî or connecting with others through <0>Motiv'Her</0>, her online community that encourages more women to explore and thrive in technology.

 Whether she‚Äôs writing software or speaking to an audience, Helvira brings the same curiosity and care to everything she creates ‚Äî always aiming to spark inspiration, one line of code (or one talk) at a time.

subtext.part_1: who loves coding back & front and shares stories on stage.
subtext.part_2: I turn complex tech into playful, powerful experiences - whether I'm writing code, leading projects or inspiring audiences.

career.title: The Path
career.subtitle: Developer Journey
career.description: Here, you can follow my tracks on my tech journey

sunday.first: - Designed and implemented B2B user management with advanced search and update features [ReactJS, Typescript, Material UI]
sunday.second: - Build autonomous client-side order functionality, without initial staff or waiter intervention [ReactJS, Typescript, Java, Kotlin]
sunday.third: - Implemented robust navigation with native transitions, history management, and offline synchronization with local persistence [Kotlin Multiplatform, Swift, Android, Ruby, Kotlin, GitHub Actions]

op.first: - Implementation of a CMD+K search engine (based on the Slack model) [Elasticsearch, Laravel, Modular architecture, ReactJS, Material UI, REST API]
op.second: - Creation of 3 back-end and front-end libraries [Laravel, Typescript]
op.third: - Application technology upgrade (from Blade to React)

ox.first: - Preparation of new features in collaboration with the product team, following specifications

re.first: - Setting up the notification center for platform users [Laravel, Bootstrap, jQuery, MariaDB]
re.second: - Implementation of a tagging functionality based on Trello model [Laravel, Bootstrap, jQuery, MariaDB, AJAX]
re.third: - Implementation of a premium version with advanced features [Laravel, Bootstrap, jQuery, MariaDB, AJAX]
re.fourth: - Design adaptation of the platform (Responsive Web design)

pa.first: - Integration of payment service providers (REST API) and graphical interfaces allowing them to be used (PayPal, Stripe, Adyen, etc.) in OOP [PHP, C#, HTML/CSS, JavaScript]
pa.second: - Collaboration with various partners, foreign banks to integrate their payment services
pa.fourth: - Monitoring of operational maintenance of developed applications
pa.fifth: - Support management, reporting and tracking of incident tickets

fallout_on_passion.title: Which Fallout Faction Reflects Your Passion?
fallout_on_passion.subtitle: Fallout on Passion

info.title: What is it
info.subTitle: The Scale of Passion
info.first: Based on this <0>study</0> where Vallerand & al. designed a scale that aims to examine whether or not people are passionate about a given activity.
info.first_bis: And this, with answering to 17 assertions rating impressions on this assertions on a scale going from 0 to 7.
info.second: This is a coded version of it with a twist ! It is based on the game series Fallout.
info.third: So here, not only, would you be able to find out if your passion as a software engineer, web developer or programmer is harmonious or obsessive.
info.fourth: But the result of your test will contribute to a larger purpose.
info.fifth: The faction with the majority will shape an evolving landscape you can find on <0>here</0>.

credits.title: Reserved Rights
credits.subTitle: All the images credits go to:

battery.title: What's Your Battery Level?
battery.subtitle: A burnout assessment quiz
battery.caption: üí° Answer honestly for the most accurate assessment

currentLevel.title: Current battery level
currentLevel.caption: Based on {{ activeStep }} of {{ totalQuestions }} answers

questions.1: How often do you feel emotionally drained from your work?
questions.2: How often do you feel used up at the end of the workday?
questions.3: How often do you feel tired when you get up in the morning and have to face another day at work?
questions.4: How often does working with people all day feel like a strain?
questions.5: How often do you feel burned out from your work?
questions.6: How often do you feel frustrated by your work?
questions.7: How often do you feel you're working too hard on your job?
questions.8: How often does working directly with people put too much stress on you?
questions.9: How often do you feel like you're at the end of your rope?
questions.10: How often do you feel you treat some people as if they were impersonal objects?
questions.11: How often have you become more callous toward people since you started this job?
questions.12: How often do you worry that this job is hardening you emotionally?
questions.13: How often do you feel you don't really care what happens to some people you work with?
questions.14: How often do you feel people blame you for some of their problems?
questions.15: How often can you easily understand how others feel about things?
questions.16: How often do you deal effectively with the problems of others?
questions.17: How often do you feel you're positively influencing others' lives through your work?
questions.18: How often do you feel very energetic?
questions.19: How often can you easily create a relaxed atmosphere with others?
questions.20: How often do you feel exhilarated after working closely with others?
questions.21: How often have you accomplished many worthwhile things in this job?
questions.22: How often do you feel you can deal with problems calmly and effectively in your work?

options.1: A few times a year or less

results.caption: About this assessment
results.subCaption: This quiz is based on <0>the Maslach Burnout Inventory</0>. For self-reflection and entertainment. If experiencing serious burnout, consult a mental health professional.
results.todo: What you can do right now:

full.title: üîã Fully Charged (100-80%)
full.description: You're that mythical creature who actually brings the charger cable to meetings 'just in case.' Your energy reserves are solid, work feels meaningful, and you're genuinely excited about Monday morning (yes, really). You probably have a color-coded calendar and actually take your lunch breaks.
full.advice: Keep those boundaries sacred. Whatever you're doing‚Äîthe early gym sessions, the hard no to Sunday emails, the actual vacation time‚Äîdon't let anyone guilt you into stopping.
full.personality: The Energizer Bunny (but make it sustainable)

optimal.title: üîã Running Smooth (79-60%)
optimal.description: You're doing well, but you've started calculating how many hours until the weekend on Tuesday afternoon. Work is still engaging and you care about what you do, but you're also strategic about saying 'let me check my bandwidth' instead of automatic yeses.
optimal.advice: This is the sweet spot, but it's also where people get complacent. Schedule that PTO now before Q4 gets crazy. Build in buffer time between big projects.

low.title: ü™´ Low Power Mode (59-40%)
low.description: Your Slack status is permanently set to 'Focus Time' but you're actually just staring at the wall. Every meeting feels like it could have been an email. You reply 'sounds good' to messages you didn't fully read. Your coffee consumption has doubled but effectiveness has halved.
low.advice: Yellow alert territory. Time to have that conversation with your manager about workload. Take that mental health day you've been postponing. Delete at least three things from your to-do list.

critical.title: ü™´ Critical Warning (39-20%)
critical.description: You're that phone that dies at 15% even though it claims higher. Your 'out of office' message is basically a cry for help with professional language. The phrase 'circle back' makes you irrationally angry. Running on spite, expired cold brew, and vague hope.
critical.advice: This is serious. Take time off‚Äîreal time off. Talk to HR, your manager, or a professional about burnout. Something has to change: workload, role, boundaries, or environment.

emergency.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Emergency Shutdown (<20%)
emergency.description: You're the phone that's been plugged in for an hour but still shows 5%. You've automated your out-of-office to just say 'No.' The idea of opening your laptop makes you physically nauseous. You can't remember the last time you felt... anything?
emergency.advice: STOP. This is not sustainable. Take medical leave if you can. See a therapist or doctor‚Äîburnout has real health consequences. Your worth is not your productivity. Consider whether this role/company/career is actively harming you.

skills.title: Which dairy embodies your tech skills?
skills.subtitle: A tech skills expiration assessment quiz
skills.caption: üí° Answer honestly for the most accurate assessment

quiz.startCaption: Start answering to see your freshness level!

1.q: When did you last learn a new programming language or framework?

2.q: How often do you read technical blogs, documentation, or follow tech news?

options.1: Daily or several times a week

3.q: What's your primary tech stack's relevance?

4.q: How do you feel when facing completely unfamiliar technology?

options.1: Excited! I love learning new things
options.2: Confident I can figure it out
options.4: Prefer to stick with what I know

5.q: How active are you in tech communities?

options.1: Very active: contribute, answer questions, engage regularly
options.3: Minimally: only when I need help

6.q: When solving problems, you tend to:

options.1: Explore modern best practices and new approaches
options.2: Mix proven methods with some newer techniques
options.3: Rely on approaches that have worked before
options.4: Stick to 'the way we've always done it'

7.q: How much time do you dedicate to learning vs. doing familiar work?

options.1: 20%+ of my time on continuous learning
options.4: Almost entirely focused on familiar tasks

8.q: When was your last side project or open-source contribution?

9.q: How familiar are you with AI/ML tools in your workflow?

options.1: Actively using them daily (GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, etc.)
options.3: Aware of them but haven't really used them
options.4: Not interested or don't see the value

10.q: How comfortable are you with cloud technologies?

options.1: Deploy and manage cloud infrastructure regularly
options.2: Use cloud services but basics only

result.title: You're {{ resultCategory }}!
result.linkText: I took the "Which dairy embodies your tech skills?" quiz and I'm {{ resultName }}! üéØ Score: {{ score }}/50 ({{ percentage }}%)

cream.name: Fresh Cream
cream.description: You're at the cutting edge! Your skills are fresh and constantly being renewed, but remember: you need regular refreshing to stay this way. Keep that momentum going!
cream.advice: Consider mentoring others to deepen your knowledge while staying current.

yogurt.name: Yogurt
yogurt.description: You're actively cultivating your skills through regular practice and learning. You've got good cultures growing, and with consistent care, you'll keep getting better!
yogurt.advice: Focus on depth in a few areas while maintaining breadth awareness.

cheese.name: Aged Cheese
cheese.description: Your foundational skills are solid and actually improve with time. Like a fine cheese, you've got expertise that deepens. Just make sure you're not getting too crusty around the edges!
cheese.advice: Balance your deep expertise with exposure to emerging trends in your field.

butter.name: Butter
butter.description: You're versatile and stable, surviving most environments. Your skills are reliable but might need some freshening up to spread into new areas.
butter.advice: Set aside dedicated time each week for learning something new.

iceCream.name: Ice Cream
iceCream.description: Your skills might be melting under pressure! Time to get back in the freezer and preserve what you have while adding new flavors. The good news? It's never too late to refresh!
iceCream.advice: Start with small, consistent learning habits. Pick one new skill to focus on this month.
